summary: An email from an Assistant U.S. Attorney in the Southern District of New York to defense attorney Robert C. Josefsberg, written shortly after Jeffrey Epstein's arrest. The prosecutor notes that information about the arrest has leaked to the media before they could complete victim outreach and requests a call to discuss the current status to relay to Josefsberg's client(s).

persons.name: Robert C. Josefsberg
persons.context: The recipient of the email, an attorney whose client(s) are apparently relevant to the Epstein case. The prosecutor is reaching out to inform him of the status of Epstein's arrest.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the arrest that has leaked to the media. The email is in the context of notifying victims and their counsel about his arrest.

connections.description: Josefsberg is an attorney whose client(s) are involved in the Epstein case, as the prosecutor is contacting him to relay information about Epstein's arrest status.

events.title: Prosecutor Outreach After Epstein Arrest Leak
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney emails defense attorney Robert C. Josefsberg after information about Jeffrey Epstein's arrest leaks to the media, attempting to provide an official update on the status.

events.title: Arrest of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: The arrest of Jeffrey Epstein, which had recently occurred and whose information leaked to the media before prosecutors could complete victim outreach.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested, and information about it leaked to the media before prosecutors could complete outreach to victims and their counsel.
An Assistant U.S. Attorney from the Southern District of New York proactively reached out to defense attorney Robert C. Josefsberg to provide an official status update on the arrest.
The email indicates the prosecution was attempting to manage communications carefully regarding the high-profile arrest.
